reentrant call."}],"SafeERC20FailedOperation(address)":[{"details":"An operation with an ERC-20 token failed."}]},"events":{"Deposit(address,uint256)":{"params":{"amount":"The amount of ETH deposited.","user":"The address of the user who deposited."}},"EntryFeeCollected(address,address,uint256,uint256)":{"params":{"amount":"The amount of the entry fee collected.","player":"The address of the player from whom the fee was collected.","riddleId":"The ID of the riddle for which the entry fee was collected.","token":"The address of the ERC20 token used for the entry fee."}},"EthReceived(address,uint256)":{"params":{"amount":"The amount of ETH received.","sender":"The address from which ETH was received."}},"GuessRevealed(address,uint256,bytes32)":{"params":{"player":"The address of the player who revealed the guess.","revealedHash":"The hash of the revealed guess.","riddleId":"The ID of the riddle for which the guess was revealed."}},"GuessSubmitted(address,uint256,bytes32)":{"params":{"guessHash":"The hashed guess submitted by the player.","player":"The address of the player who submitted the guess.","riddleId":"The ID of the riddle for which the guess was submitted."}},"OwnerWithdrawTokens(uint256)":{"params":{"amount":"The amount of ERC20 tokens withdrawn by the owner."}},"OwnerWithdrawal(address,uint256)":{"params":{"amount":"The amount of ETH withdrawn by the owner.","owner":"The address of the contract owner."}},"PayoutExecuted(uint256,address[],uint256)":{"params":{"riddleId":"The ID of the riddle for which the payout occurred.","totalAmount":"The total amount of prize distributed in this batch.","winners":"The array of addresses of the winners who received a payout in this batch."}},"PlayerEntered(address,uint256)":{"params":{"player":"The address of the player who entered.","riddleId":"The ID of the riddle the player entered."}},"PrizeDistributed(address,uint256,uint8)":{"params":{"amount":"The amount of the prize distributed.","prizeType":"The type of prize (ETH or ERC20).","winner":"The address of the prize winner."}},"PrizeFunded(address,uint256,uint8)":{"params":{"amount":"The amount of ETH or ERC20 tokens added to the prize pool.","funder":"The address that funded the prize pool.","prizeType":"The type of prize (ETH or ERC20)."}},"RetryPurchased(address,uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"details":"While `_riddleId` indicates the active riddle at the time of purchase, retries are tracked globally per user and are reset when a user interacts with a new riddle.","params":{"cost":"The cost of the retry.","newRetryCount":"The new number of retries available to the player.","player":"The address of the player who purchased the retry.","riddleId":"The ID of the riddle for which the retry was purchased."}},"RiddleInitialized(uint256,bytes32,uint8,address,uint256,address)":{"params":{"answerHash":"The hash of the answer to the new riddle.","entryFeeTokenAddress":"The address of the ERC20 token for the entry fee, otherwise address(0).","prizeAmount":"The amount of the prize.","prizeTokenAddress":"The address of the ERC20 token if prizeType is ERC20, otherwise address(0).","prizeType":"The type of prize (ETH or ERC20).","riddleId":"The unique identifier for the new riddle."}},"Withdrawal(address,uint256)":{"params":{"amount":"The amount of ETH withdrawn.","user":"The address of the user who withdrew."}}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"deposit()":{"details":"The deposited ETH can later be withdrawn by the user."},"enterGame(uint256)":{"details":"This function handles the collection of entry fees. It requires an exact transfer amount,      meaning fee-on-transfer (FOT) tokens are NOT supported. Players can only enter the active riddle.","params":{"_riddleId":"The ID of the riddle the player wishes to enter."}},"fundTokenPrizePool(uint256)":{"details":"This function can only be called if the current riddle's prize type is ERC20.","params":{"_amount":"The amount of ERC20 tokens to transfer from the owner to the contract's prize pool."}},"getPrizeToken()":{"details":"Returns address(0) if the prize type is ETH or if no prize token is set.","returns":{"_0":"The address of the prize token."}},"owner()":{"details":"Returns the address of the current owner."},"ownerWithdraw(uint256)":{"details":"This function can only be called by the contract owner.","params":{"_amount":"The amount of ETH to withdraw from the prize pool."}},"ownerWithdrawTokens(uint256)":{"details":"This function can only be called by the contract owner.It ensures that the requested amount is available in the prize pool and performs a safe transfer.","params":{"_amount":"The amount of ERC20 tokens to withdraw from the token prize pool."}},"payout(uint256,address[])":{"details":"This function can only be called by the contract owner.      It allows for batched payouts to manage gas limits for riddles with many winners.      The riddle is marked as fully paid out only when all registered winners have received their prize.      **Prize Calculation and Distribution:**      1.  **Per-Winner Amount:** The total `prizeAmount` for the riddle (from `riddleConfigs[_riddleId].prizeAmount`)          is divided equally among `totalWinnersCount[_riddleId]` to determine the base `perWinnerAmount`.      2.  **Remainder Distribution:** Any remainder from the division (`prizeAmount % totalWinnersCount`)          is distributed by adding 1 unit to the `perWinnerAmount` for the first `remainder` number of          *unpaid* winners. This ensures all prize funds are distributed.      3.  **Batch Processing:** The function processes winners in batches (`_winnersBatch`) to manage gas costs.          It first calculates the `totalAmountToDistributeInBatch` by summing the individual prize amounts          (including any remainder portions) for eligible winners within the current batch.      4.  **Eligibility:** Only winners who are registered (`isWinner[_riddleId][winner]`) and have not yet          claimed their prize (`!hasClaimed[_riddleId][winner]`) are eligible for payout in a batch.      5.  **Fund Check:** Before initiating transfers, the function verifies that the respective prize pool          (ETH or ERC20) has sufficient balance to cover the `totalAmountToDistributeInBatch`.      6.  **Individual Distribution:** Each eligible winner in the batch receives their calculated prize amount          via the internal `_distributePrize` function.      **Reentrancy Safety:**      -   The `nonReentrant` modifier is used to prevent reentrancy attacks during external calls          made by `_distributePrize` (e.g., ETH transfers).      -   The `hasClaimed[_riddleId][winner]` state is updated *before* the external prize distribution call          to adhere to the Checks-Effects-Interactions pattern, further mitigating reentrancy risks.      **State Updates:**      -   `hasClaimed[_riddleId][winner]` is set to `true` for each winner successfully paid.      -   `paidWinnersCount[_riddleId]` is incremented for each winner paid.      -   `totalPrizeDistributed[_riddleId]` accumulates the total prize paid for the riddle.      -   `hasReceivedRemainder[_riddleId][winner]` is set to `true` for winners who receive a remainder portion.      -   `isPaidOut[_riddleId]` is set to `true` once `paidWinnersCount[_riddleId]` equals `totalWinnersCount[_riddleId]`,          indicating all winners for the riddle have been paid.      **Event Emission:**      -   `PayoutExecuted(_riddleId, _winnersBatch, totalAmountToDistributeInBatch)` is emitted after each          successful batch payout, providing details of the riddle, the winners in the batch, and the total          amount distributed in that batch.","params":{"_riddleId":"The ID of the riddle for which prizes are being paid out.","_winnersBatch":"An array of addresses of the winners to be paid in this batch."}},"purchaseRetry(uint256)":{"details":"The player must pay the RETRY_COST in retryToken.","params":{"_riddleId":"The ID of the riddle for which the retry is being purchased."}},"renounceOwnership()":{"details":"Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner."},"revealGuess(uint256,string)":{"details":"This function is part of the commit-reveal scheme. It verifies the revealed guess      against the committed hash and ensures the reveal delay has passed.","params":{"_guess":"The player's actual guess string.","_riddleId":"The ID of the riddle for which the guess is being revealed."}},"setRevealDelay(uint256)":{"details":"The reveal delay is the minimum time in seconds that must pass between      committing a guess and revealing it.","params":{"_newRevealDelay":"The new reveal delay in seconds."}},"setRiddle(uint256,bytes32,uint8,address,uint256,address)":{"details":"The `_riddleId` must be greater than the `currentRiddleId` to ensure monotonic progression and prevent replay attacks.      The `ethPrizePool` and `tokenPrizePool` are reset to 0 for each new riddle.      Requires `_prizeTokenAddress` to be a valid ERC20 contract if `_prizeType` is ERC20.      Requires `_entryFeeTokenAddress` to be a valid ERC20 contract if `ENTRY_FEE` is greater than 0.","params":{"_answerHash":"The hash of the answer to the new riddle.","_entryFeeTokenAddress":"The address of the ERC20 token for the entry fee, otherwise address(0).","_prizeAmount":"The amount of the prize.","_prizeTokenAddress":"The address of the ERC20 token if prizeType is ERC20, otherwise address(0).","_prizeType":"The type of prize (ETH or ERC20).","_riddleId":"The unique identifier for the new riddle."}},"solveRiddleAndClaim(string)":{"details":"IMPORTANT DEPLOYMENT NOTE: The hashing mechanism for answers was changed from `abi.encodePacked` to `abi.encode`      for improved security. This is a BREAKING CHANGE for existing riddles.      Deployment to an existing system requires a migration plan:      1. Ensure no active riddles are using the old `abi.encodePacked` hashing.      2. If active riddles exist, they must be resolved or invalidated safely.      3. A one-time migration script might be needed to re-hash existing answers if applicable,         or new riddle creation should be locked until existing prize pools are cleared."},"submitGuess(uint256,bytes32)":{"details":"This function records a player's commitment to a guess. The actual guess is revealed later using `revealGuess`.      This prevents front-running and ensures fair play.      **Hash Requirements:**      The `_guessHash` must be the `keccak256` hash of the player's intended guess.      It is crucial to use `abi.encodePacked` for hashing the guess string to match the contract's internal hashing mechanism.      Example: `keccak256(abi.encodePacked(\"mysecretguess\"))`      **Winner Evaluation:**      If the submitted `_guessHash` matches the riddle's `sAnswerHash`, the player is immediately marked as a potential winner.      However, the prize is only claimable after successfully revealing the guess via `revealGuess` and then calling `solveRiddleAndClaim`.      **Retry Usage:**      If a player has previously submitted a guess for the current riddle and their new `_guessHash` does not match the `sAnswerHash`,      a retry is consumed. Players can purchase retries using `purchaseRetry` up to `MAX_RETRIES`.      If a retry is used, the previous committed guess and its timestamp are cleared, allowing a new guess to be committed. This also clears any previously revealed guess and its state for the current riddle, requiring a fresh commit-reveal cycle.      **Emitted Events:**      - `GuessSubmitted(player, riddleId, guessHash)`: Always emitted when a guess is successfully committed.      - `WinnerFound(winner, riddleId)`: Emitted if the `_guessHash` matches the `sAnswerHash` and the player was not already a winner.      - `GuessEvaluated(riddleId, player, timestamp, isWinner)`: Emitted after evaluating the guess, indicating if it was correct.      **Example Usage (Solidity):**      ```solidity      string memory playerGuess = \"mysecretanswer\";      bytes32 hashedGuess = keccak256(abi.encodePacked(playerGuess));      vaultisContract.submitGuess(currentRiddleId, hashedGuess);      ```      **Example Usage (Web3.js/Ethers.js):**      ```javascript      const playerGuess = \"mysecretanswer\";      const hashedGuess = web3.utils.soliditySha3({ type: \"string\", value: playerGuess });      // Or for ethers.js:      // const hashedGuess = ethers.utils.solidityKeccak256([\"string\"], [playerGuess]); // For ethers v5.x      // const hashedGuess = ethers.solidityPackedKeccak256([\"string\"], [playerGuess]); // For ethers v6.x      await vaultisContract.methods.submitGuess(currentRiddleId, hashedGuess).send({ from: playerAddress });      ```","params":{"_guessHash":"The `keccak256` hash of the player's guess. Must not be `bytes32(0)`.","_riddleId":"The ID of the riddle for which the guess is being submitted. Must be the `currentRiddleId`."}},"transferOwnership(address)":{"details":"Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner."},"withdraw(uint256)":{"params":{"_amount":"The amount of ETH to withdraw."}}},"version":1},"userdoc":{"events":{"Deposit(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted when a user deposits ETH into their balance."},"EntryFeeCollected(address,address,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted when an entry fee is successfully collected from a player."},"EthReceived(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted when ETH is received by the contract via the `receive` function."},"GuessRevealed(address,uint256,bytes32)":{"notice":"Emitted when a player successfully reveals their guess for a riddle."},"GuessSubmitted(address,uint256,bytes32)":{"notice":"Emitted when a player successfully submits a hashed guess for a riddle."},"OwnerWithdrawTokens(uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted when the contract owner withdraws ERC20 tokens from the token prize pool."},"OwnerWithdrawal(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted when the contract owner withdraws ETH from the prize pool."},"PayoutExecuted(uint256,address[],uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted after a batch payout to multiple winners is successfully executed."},"PlayerEntered(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted when a player successfully enters a riddle."},"PrizeDistributed(address,uint256,uint8)":{"notice":"Emitted when a prize is successfully distributed to a winner."},"PrizeFunded(address,uint256,uint8)":{"notice":"Emitted when the prize pool is funded with ETH or ERC20 tokens."},"RetryPurchased(address,uint256,uint256,uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted when a player successfully purchases a retry for a riddle."},"RiddleInitialized(uint256,bytes32,uint8,address,uint256,address)":{"notice":"Emitted when a new riddle is successfully initialized."},"Withdrawal(address,uint256)":{"notice":"Emitted when a user withdraws ETH from their balance."}},"kind":"user","methods":{"deposit()":{"notice":"Allows a user to deposit ETH into their personal balance within the contract."},"enterGame(uint256)":{"notice":"Allows a player to enter the game for a specific riddle by paying an entry fee."},"fundTokenPrizePool(uint256)":{"notice":"Allows the contract owner to fund the ERC20 token prize pool."},"getPrizeToken()":{"notice":"Returns the address of the ERC20 prize token currently set for the active riddle."},"ownerWithdraw(uint256)":{"notice":"Allows the contract owner to withdraw ETH from the `ethPrizePool`."},"ownerWithdrawTokens(uint256)":{"notice":"Allows the contract owner to withdraw ERC20 tokens from the Ykhy68PR3B4AgD7asuQk7PwkWxrvJbZcikLF"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/token/ERC20/IERC20.sol":{"keccak256":"0x74ed01eb66b923d0d0cfe3be84604ac04b76482a55f9dd655e1ef4d367f95bc2","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://5282825a626cfe924e504274b864a652b0023591fa66f06a067b25b51ba9b303","dweb:/ipfs/QmeCfPykghhMc81VJTrHTC7sF6CRvaA1FXVq2pJhwYp1dV"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/token/ERC20/utils/SafeERC20.sol":{"keccak256":"0x982c5cb790ab941d1e04f807120a71709d4c313ba0bfc16006447ffbd27fbbd5","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://8150ceb4ac947e8a442b2a9c017e01e880b2be2dd958f1fa9bc405f4c5a86508","dweb:/ipfs/QmbcBmFX66AY6Kbhnd5gx7zpkgqnUafo43XnmayAM7zVdB"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/utils/Context.sol":{"keccak256":"0x493033a8d1b176a037b2cc6a04dad01a5c157722049bbecf632ca876224dd4b2","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://6a708e8a5bdb1011c2c381c9a5cfd8a9a956d7d0a9dc1bd8bcdaf52f76ef2f12","dweb:/ipfs/Qmax9WHBnVsZP46ZxEMNRQpLQnrdE4dK8LehML1Py8FowF"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/utils/ReentrancyGuard.sol":{"keccak256":"0x11a5a79827df29e915a12740caf62fe21ebe27c08c9ae3e09abe9ee3ba3866d3","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://3cf0c69ab827e3251db9ee6a50647d62c90ba580a4d7bbff21f2bea39e7b2f4a","dweb:/ipfs/QmZiKwtKU1SBX4RGfQtY7PZfiapbbu6SZ9vizGQD9UHjRA"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/utils/introspection/IERC165.sol":{"keccak256":"0x8891738ffe910f0cf2da09566928589bf5d63f4524dd734fd9cedbac3274dd5c","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://971f954442df5c2ef5b5ebf1eb245d7105d9fbacc7386ee5c796df1d45b21617","dweb:/ipfs/QmadRjHbkicwqwwh61raUEapaVEtaLMcYbQZWs9gUkgj3u"]}},"version":1}

deposit().details: The deposited ETH can later be withdrawn by the user.

enterGame(uint256).details: This function handles the collection of entry fees. It requires an exact transfer amount,      meaning fee-on-transfer (FOT) tokens are NOT supported. Players can only enter the active riddle.

params._riddleId: The ID of the riddle the player wishes to enter.

fundTokenPrizePool(uint256).details: This function can only be called if the current riddle's prize type is ERC20.

params._amount: The amount of ERC20 tokens to transfer from the owner to the contract's prize pool.

getPrizeToken().details: Returns address(0) if the prize type is ETH or if no prize token is set.

returns._0: The address of the prize token.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

ownerWithdraw(uint256).details: This function can only be called by the contract owner.

params._amount: The amount of ETH to withdraw from the prize pool.

ownerWithdrawTokens(uint256).details: This function can only be called by the contract owner.It ensures that the requested amount is available in the prize pool and performs a safe transfer.

params._amount: The amount of ERC20 tokens to withdraw from the token prize pool.

payout(uint256,address[]).details: This function can only be called by the contract owner.      It allows for batched payouts to manage gas limits for riddles with many winners.      The riddle is marked as fully paid out only when all registered winners have received their prize.      **Prize Calculation and Distribution:**      1.  **Per-Winner Amount:** The total `prizeAmount` for the riddle (from `riddleConfigs[_riddleId].prizeAmount`)          is divided equally among `totalWinnersCount[_riddleId]` to determine the base `perWinnerAmount`.      2.  **Remainder Distribution:** Any remainder from the division (`prizeAmount % totalWinnersCount`)          is distributed by adding 1 unit to the `perWinnerAmount` for the first `remainder` number of          *unpaid* winners. This ensures all prize funds are distributed.      3.  **Batch Processing:** The function processes winners in batches (`_winnersBatch`) to manage gas costs.          It first calculates the `totalAmountToDistributeInBatch` by summing the individual prize amounts          (including any remainder portions) for eligible winners within the current batch.      4.  **Eligibility:** Only winners who are registered (`isWinner[_riddleId][winner]`) and have not yet          claimed their prize (`!hasClaimed[_riddleId][winner]`) are eligible for payout in a batch.      5.  **Fund Check:** Before initiating transfers, the function verifies that the respective prize pool          (ETH or ERC20) has sufficient balance to cover the `totalAmountToDistributeInBatch`.      6.  **Individual Distribution:** Each eligible winner in the batch receives their calculated prize amount          via the internal `_distributePrize` function.      **Reentrancy Safety:**      -   The `nonReentrant` modifier is used to prevent reentrancy attacks during external calls          made by `_distributePrize` (e.g., ETH transfers).      -   The `hasClaimed[_riddleId][winner]` state is updated *before* the external prize distribution call          to adhere to the Checks-Effects-Interactions pattern, further mitigating reentrancy risks.      **State Updates:**      -   `hasClaimed[_riddleId][winner]` is set to `true` for each winner successfully paid.      -   `paidWinnersCount[_riddleId]` is incremented for each winner paid.      -   `totalPrizeDistributed[_riddleId]` accumulates the total prize paid for the riddle.      -   `hasReceivedRemainder[_riddleId][winner]` is set to `true` for winners who receive a remainder portion.      -   `isPaidOut[_riddleId]` is set to `true` once `paidWinnersCount[_riddleId]` equals `totalWinnersCount[_riddleId]`,          indicating all winners for the riddle have been paid.      **Event Emission:**      -   `PayoutExecuted(_riddleId, _winnersBatch, totalAmountToDistributeInBatch)` is emitted after each          successful batch payout, providing details of the riddle, the winners in the batch, and the total          amount distributed in that batch.

params._riddleId: The ID of the riddle for which prizes are being paid out.
params._winnersBatch: An array of addresses of the winners to be paid in this batch.

purchaseRetry(uint256).details: The player must pay the RETRY_COST in retryToken.

params._riddleId: The ID of the riddle for which the retry is being purchased.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

revealGuess(uint256,string).details: This function is part of the commit-reveal scheme. It verifies the revealed guess      against the committed hash and ensures the reveal delay has passed.

params._riddleId: The ID of the riddle for which the guess is being revealed.

setRevealDelay(uint256).details: The reveal delay is the minimum time in seconds that must pass between      committing a guess and revealing it.

params._newRevealDelay: The new reveal delay in seconds.

setRiddle(uint256,bytes32,uint8,address,.details: The `_riddleId` must be greater than the `currentRiddleId` to ensure monotonic progression and prevent replay attacks.      The `ethPrizePool` and `tokenPrizePool` are reset to 0 for each new riddle.      Requires `_prizeTokenAddress` to be a valid ERC20 contract if `_prizeType` is ERC20.      Requires `_entryFeeTokenAddress` to be a valid ERC20 contract if `ENTRY_FEE` is greater than 0.

params._answerHash: The hash of the answer to the new riddle.
params._entryFeeTokenAddress: The address of the ERC20 token for the entry fee, otherwise address(0).
params._prizeTokenAddress: The address of the ERC20 token if prizeType is ERC20, otherwise address(0).
params._prizeType: The type of prize (ETH or ERC20).
params._riddleId: The unique identifier for the new riddle.

solveRiddleAndClaim(string).details: IMPORTANT DEPLOYMENT NOTE: The hashing mechanism for answers was changed from `abi.encodePacked` to `abi.encode`      for improved security. This is a BREAKING CHANGE for existing riddles.      Deployment to an existing system requires a migration plan:      1. Ensure no active riddles are using the old `abi.encodePacked` hashing.      2. If active riddles exist, they must be resolved or invalidated safely.      3. A one-time migration script might be needed to re-hash existing answers if applicable,         or new riddle creation should be locked until existing prize pools are cleared.

submitGuess(uint256,bytes32).details: This function records a player's commitment to a guess. The actual guess is revealed later using `revealGuess`.      This prevents front-running and ensures fair play.      **Hash Requirements:**      The `_guessHash` must be the `keccak256` hash of the player's intended guess.      It is crucial to use `abi.encodePacked` for hashing the guess string to match the contract's internal hashing mechanism.      Example: `keccak256(abi.encodePacked("mysecretguess"))`      **Winner Evaluation:**      If the submitted `_guessHash` matches the riddle's `sAnswerHash`, the player is immediately marked as a potential winner.      However, the prize is only claimable after successfully revealing the guess via `revealGuess` and then calling `solveRiddleAndClaim`.      **Retry Usage:**      If a player has previously submitted a guess for the current riddle and their new `_guessHash` does not match the `sAnswerHash`,      a retry is consumed. Players can purchase retries using `purchaseRetry` up to `MAX_RETRIES`.      If a retry is used, the previous committed guess and its timestamp are cleared, allowing a new guess to be committed. This also clears any previously revealed guess and its state for the current riddle, requiring a fresh commit-reveal cycle.      **Emitted Events:**      - `GuessSubmitted(player, riddleId, guessHash)`: Always emitted when a guess is successfully committed.      - `WinnerFound(winner, riddleId)`: Emitted if the `_guessHash` matches the `sAnswerHash` and the player was not already a winner.      - `GuessEvaluated(riddleId, player, timestamp, isWinner)`: Emitted after evaluating the guess, indicating if it was correct.      **Example Usage (Solidity):**      ```solidity      string memory playerGuess = "mysecretanswer";      bytes32 hashedGuess = keccak256(abi.encodePacked(playerGuess));      vaultisContract.submitGuess(currentRiddleId, hashedGuess);      ```      **Example Usage (Web3.js/Ethers.js):**      ```javascript      const playerGuess = "mysecretanswer";      const hashedGuess = web3.utils.soliditySha3({ type: "string", value: playerGuess });      // Or for ethers.js:      // const hashedGuess = ethers.utils.solidityKeccak256(["string"], [playerGuess]); // For ethers v5.x      // const hashedGuess = ethers.solidityPackedKeccak256(["string"], [playerGuess]); // For ethers v6.x      await vaultisContract.methods.submitGuess(currentRiddleId, hashedGuess).send({ from: playerAddress });      ```

params._guessHash: The `keccak256` hash of the player's guess. Must not be `bytes32(0)`.
params._riddleId: The ID of the riddle for which the guess is being submitted. Must be the `currentRiddleId`.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

params._amount: The amount of ETH to withdraw.

deposit().notice: Allows a user to deposit ETH into their personal balance within the contract.

enterGame(uint256).notice: Allows a player to enter the game for a specific riddle by paying an entry fee.

fundTokenPrizePool(uint256).notice: Allows the contract owner to fund the ERC20 token prize pool.

getPrizeToken().notice: Returns the address of the ERC20 prize token currently set for the active riddle.

ownerWithdraw(uint256).notice: Allows the contract owner to withdraw ETH from the `ethPrizePool`.

ownerWithdrawTokens(uint256).notice: Allows the contract owner to withdraw ERC20 tokens from the `tokenPrizePool`.

payout(uint256,address[]).notice: Handles prize distribution to a batch of winning addresses for a specific riddle.

purchaseRetry(uint256).notice: Allows a player to purchase a retry for a specific riddle.

revealGuess(uint256,string).notice: Allows a player to reveal their previously committed guess for a riddle.

setRevealDelay(uint256).notice: Allows the contract owner to set the minimum reveal delay for guesses.

setRiddle(uint256,bytes32,uint8,address,.notice: Allows the contract owner to set up a new riddle with its answer hash, prize details, and entry fee token.

submitGuess(uint256,bytes32).notice: Allows a player to submit a hashed guess for a specific riddle as part of a commit-reveal scheme.

withdraw(uint256).notice: Allows a user to withdraw their deposited ETH from their personal balance.
